channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Millions of pupils return to school amid Covid spike concern
item.description: Schools open their classrooms to millions of pupils in England and Wales with hopes and fears.

item.title: Grenfell Tower: Families angry at lack of consultation over demolition
item.description: Bereaved relatives say they have not been consulted on when the tower will be taken down.

item.title: Claudia Lawrence: Police end Sand Hutton lake search
item.description: Nothing significant was found during a new search for clues to the chef's disappearance, police say.

item.title: Essex man called 999 to demand a lift after missing bus
item.description: Another man used the emergency line to complain about being thrown out of a pub, Essex Police says.

item.title: Young footballer dies after West Bridgford match collapse
item.description: Dylan Rich, 17, is suspected to have suffered a cardiac arrest during the game in Nottinghamshire.

item.title: Bournemouth beach rape: Crimewatch appeal over sea assault
item.description: Police will reveal the supposed nickname or first name of the suspect on BBC Crimewatch Live.

item.title: Frozen eggs and sperm to get 55-year storage limit
item.description: The health secretary says it "will help turn off the ticking clock in the back of people's minds".

item.title: London's unemployment situation explained
item.description: Why is the capital's unemployment rate is higher than the rest of the UK?

item.title: Bournemouth Air Festival crash pilot avoided a 'catastrophe'
item.description: The crash at Bournemouth Air Festival involving a wing-walker biplane left two people injured.

item.title: Windermere: Holocaust survivor's daughter thanks rescuer
item.description: Bela Rosenthal was one of 300 young children brought to Windermere in 1945 to start a new life.

item.title: Cornwall cycling hub 'to form Tour of Britain legacy'
item.description: The £7m project in Cornwall is expected to host races and cater for all abilities.

item.title: Channel Migrants: First group since August reaches Dover
item.description: The first group of people since August are brought ashore by the UK Border Force on Sunday.

item.title: Jordan Sinnott: Charity match to honour killed footballer
item.description: Matlock Town midfielder Jordan Sinnott died after being attacked on a night out.

item.title: Man in his 60s dies in house blaze
item.description: The man's death in Swindon early on Sunday is not being treated as suspicious, police say.

item.title: Women 'marry' trees to highlight Bristol building plans
item.description: Organisers of the Bristol ceremony say new apartment plans threaten the future of 74 mature trees.

item.title: 'I hid my litter picker in my suitcase'
item.description: Jenny I'Anson, 73, says she can spend up to five hours a day clearing rubbish.

item.title: NHS wait times: 'I’m not half the man I was'
item.description: Wayne Dennis, 50, has been waiting more than two years for treatment to his gallbladder.

item.title: Chipping Norton big vegetable grower becomes Twitter hit
item.description: Gerald Stratford says fertiliser and patience are behind his vegetables growing so big.

item.title: Ironbridge power station chimney demolished
item.description: The last major structure at the Ironbridge Power Station is brought down in a controlled explosion.

item.title: Wirral Mind fundraiser completes year of daily 10km runs
item.description: Phill Hayward kept his challenge interesting by going runs while dribbling a ball and running in heels.

item.title: Attenborough ATM raid: Thieves wreck machine but flee empty-handed
item.description: Police say they left the scene in a getaway car after abandoning the cash machine and stolen van.

item.title: Two missing divers presumed dead off Cornwall coast
item.description: The divers were exploring a former Royal Navy frigate which was sunk to create an offshore reef.

item.title: Essex baby given £1.79m drug makes 'huge progress'
item.description: Eleven-month-old Edward is able to support his head after receiving the world's most expensive drug.

item.title: Stamford Hill: Man in court over unprovoked attacks
item.description: Abdullah Qureshi appears in court charged over a series of attacks in Stamford Hill, north London.

item.title: Singing Leicestershire plumber lands record deal on job
item.description: Kev Crane's talents were spotted when he sang along to the radio as he fitted bathrooms.

item.title: England v India: Rory Burns and Haseeb Hameed set up thrilling final day
item.description: England make a promising start to their pursuit of a record 368 to leave the fourth Test against India primed for a thrilling conclusion at The Kia Oval.

item.title: England 4-0 Andorra: Three Lions score three late goals after slow start
item.description: England score three times in the last 18 minutes to overcome Group I minnows Andorra and secure a fifth straight World Cup qualifying win.

item.title: Arsenal 3-2 Chelsea: Gunners stun defending champions in WSL opener
item.description: Arsenal impress at the Emirates Stadium as they secure victory over defending champions Chelsea in their Women's Super League opener.

item.title: Charlotte Edwards Cup: South East Stars beat Northern Diamonds by five wickets in final
item.description: South East Stars win the first Charlotte Edwards Cup as they beat Northern Diamonds by five wickets in the T20 final.

item.title: Max Verstappen wins home Dutch Grand Prix ahead of Lewis Hamilton
item.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen takes a dominant victory over Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton in the Dutch Grand Prix to retake the championship lead.
